text: pretty much everything on the dev box is set up
I put my ubuntu install notes in the github readme
all python code should now run regardless of where the repo is and regardless of where you are running it from

instead of hard-coded `/home/ec2-user`s we have things like:
`open(os.path.join(os.path.expanduser('~'), 'singles_prices.json'))` - open ~/singles_prices.json
`logdir = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), 'logs/recerrors')` - web/logs/recerrors (relative to dynamic.py)
I’ve also moved a lot of bulk-generated-data type stuff out of the git repo
(all the python and shell code is still in git)
so important directories now are:

/home/ubuntu - where git repos and crap we want to keep is (recdata, spoilers, youtubeseen)
/tmp - where crap we don’t want to keep is

/home/ubuntu/edhrec/web/public - non-html website assets
/usr/share/nginx/html - where generated html is stored
but yeah if we actually wanted to have a dev version of the site, it would be easier now since everything is less coupled
doesn’t have to be a separate ec2 instance or anything it could be on the same box
oh also the changes allowed me to get rid of a lot of garbage in the nginx config, and I also added a 500 error page similar to the current 404 page
a new commander vs. got released and it didnt show up in youtube monitor: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uShPuN5yal8&feature=youtu.be>

attachments.title: Commander VS S7E8: Wrexial vs Rakdos vs Zur vs Feldon [MTG]
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Commander VS S7E8: Wrexial vs Rakdos vs Zur vs Feldon [MTG]

text: I'll take a look
I'm making a list of the kind of data we would want to collect so I can look for ways to collect said data with cockatrice, I know that we would like to see win/loss and commander, anything else?
At the very least it will be those two metrics off the bat

these are the ones i want:
 — user accounts
 -- decklists
 — length of game (number of turns would be good)
 — winner of game
i looked into this a little bit already
the server can save the replays
we pull the data from the replay files
i think it would be good if you got the cockatrice server stood up + handling logins + saving replays first
that way we have some data to work with
and also that was nontrivial when i ried it
i got it stood up but it took me a while and i gave up when i started working on the email verification / registraiton
is this being set up on <http://dev.edhrec.com|dev.edhrec.com>?
i think we should set it up there
any objections?
nope
although once I build up some more confidence that everything is running properly we shouldn’t need the current <http://edhrec.com|edhrec.com> any more
yeah
i dont want to pay for it either
heh
well that’s what today’s focus is for me
see what things ran overnight and see what failed
im on vacation until monday
so go ham
cool
we can target me switching it over on monday
sounds great
I don’t think it’ll take me all week, or even all day if cron behaves, is there anything else you want me to work on?  I can put some more work into react/es/api stuff if nothing else
there are still some bugs with unofficial on the commander lists
you could finish the rec pages
i have the scores in there no
now
oh sweet
its not perfect but you could make up something

maybe you can just plug the raw numbers in there X 100 and see how it looks
or convert it to some stars or some shit
but its not ranks now

is the max still like 35ish?
theoretical max is 1-- i think, i didnt think too hard about it
it seemed to go up as i added more cards though
hmm
it’s kind of a percentage
I'll have to run some tests but I just just multiply by 2 or something if it makes them look nicer
its like the average percentage of decks that play this card base don your other cards, weighted in a funny way
so anyways i think that would be good

given that the elasticsearch thing is going to take a while since we can’t use searchkit, i wouldn’t mind if you figured out a way to make the prices easier to use and more evident on advanced filters
that’s kind of a off task if you feel like working on it
one thing i’m itching to do more of and it may tie into cockatrice later is we need to get user accounts rolling
i think im done procrastinating on that
i made `core/users.py` that has be some basic password/username functionality and the ability to store info about the user in a key/value store kind of thing
yeah I saw that
I was thinking we'd just want to set up forums/cockatrice first though and just borrow as much infrastructure from them as possible
i dont htink i want to do forums anymore
shit is too 1990s imo
s/forums\//
do you want comments on every page though?
one thing i was thinking in leiu of forums
was some sort of primer thing
hmm now that i think about that though, i want something that has something everyone can do something with
like commenting, voting on shit or somehting
i think comments per page would be good
not sure where we put it from a ui perspective
i think i’d like to do tagging & ratings
some tags for example: “mana rock”, “card draw”, “board wipe”, etc.
“win con” “combo piece”
“ramp”
this is half baked and rushed since im just vomiting out stuff since im leaving tomorrow
but i think if you could get like a basic session set up w/ a login page and registration and email verification that would take you into next week
I have some ideas for how the UI would look but I'm going to have to see what backend stuff is available
Yeah, I was debating if we wanted to tie users on edh to a 1:1 ratio for the cockatrice server user name or if we wanted to do many to one
I think 1:1 would probably be easiest to maintain
not all users are going to use cockatrice
lets just forget about that for now, we cna always fix it later
we can just have separate users for now
